thread.title: Supreme Court Curbs Protections for Whistleblowers

author: Andrew Ackerman
title: Supreme Court Curbs Protections for Whistleblowers

organizations.name: supreme court curbs protections for whistleblowers

text:
WASHINGTON—The Supreme Court ruled unanimously Wednesday that individuals must report alleged corporate wrongdoing to the Securities and Exchange Commission, not just to their companies, to qualify for whistleblower protections under the Dodd-Frank Act.
The decision narrows the SEC’s interpretation of the 2010 financial-overhaul law. The primary goal of the Dodd-Frank whistleblower provision was “to motivate people who know of securities law violations to tell the SEC,” Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg wrote for the court, quoting...
